column4: How would I install apache2 again and have it install all the files nec. for /etc/apache2?
that was a big mistake, more than apache puts files there ....
Yes I see it was a mistake
to start, do   dpkg -l '*apache*' | grep ^ii , that will find all the apache packages you have installed. Then do    sudo aptitude purge <those apache packages>
the way apt/dpkg works is, if it sees you manually removed files from etc it assumes you did it for a reason and won't put them back
and how would I have it put them back
do those first two commands I gave you, then you would reinstall apache again. By purging you tell apt to remove the /etc files itself, so on the next install it will put them back
you probably will have errors with the purge, put them on the pastebin.  I have 20 minutes
no error
good. what packages did you remove?
purge libapache2-mod-php5 apache2.2-common apache2-utils apache2-mpm-prefork
outstanding. Did you install php?
I installed LAMP when installing ubuntu-server so more than likely
you did, a sec
purge libapache2-mod-php5 . It may say it wants to remove some other packages, let it do it but make a note of them
nope that isn't even an installed package
then you installed php differently I guess. time to install apache2  sudo aptitude install apache2
that /appears/ to have worked :)
/appears/ is a good qualifier till you check
how would i have two sites on this one server?
don't ask me, I helped with a packaging question, not an apache question. I can barely get modrewrite working without hand holding
:) okay well thanks then
